title: An Extension-based Approach for Computing and Verifying Preferences in Abstract Argumentation
abstract: arXiv:2403.17653v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: We present an extension-based approach for computing and verifying preferences in an abstract argumentation system. Although numerous argumentation semantics have been developed previously for identifying acceptable sets of arguments from an argumentation framework, there is a lack of justification behind their acceptability based on implicit argument preferences. Preference-based argumentation frameworks allow one to determine what arguments are justified given a set of preferences. Our research considers the inverse of the standard reasoning problem, i.e., given an abstract argumentation framework and a set of justified arguments, we compute what the possible preferences over arguments are. Furthermore, there is a need to verify (i.e., assess) that the computed preferences would lead to the acceptable sets of arguments. translated_title: 计算和验证抽象论证中偏好的基于扩展的方法
translated_abstract: 我们提出了一种基于扩展的方法，用于计算和验证抽象论证系统中的偏好。虽然先前已经开发了许多论证语义用于从论证框架中识别可接受的论点集，但缺乏基于隐含论点偏好的可接受性背后的理由。基于偏好的论证框架可以确定在给定一组偏好的情况下哪些论点是被证明的。我们的研究考虑了标准推理问题的逆问题，即，给定一个抽象论证框架和一组被证明的论点，我们计算可能的论点偏好是什么。此外，有必要验证（即评估）计算出的偏好是否会导致可接受的论点集。本文提出了一种新的方法和算法，用于穷举计算和列举所有可能的论点集。
tldr: 提出了一种基于扩展的方法，用于计算和验证抽象论证系统中的偏好。
en_tdlr: Proposed an extension-based approach for computing and verifying preferences in abstract argumentation.
